title: DevOps
description: DevOps is a set of practices that combines software development (Dev) and IT operations (Ops). It aims to shorten the systems development life cycle and provide continuous delivery with high software quality.
key-ideas: DevOps is a key aspect of Software Development and extremely closely related to the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)
Highly associated with Agile Development Practices
Highly associated with Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery (CI/CD)
Key to DevOps is the marrying of the software developers with business operations.
The DevOps pipeline is not static but may be changed and adapted to meet team/business needs.
Automation is a key requirement of effective DevOps.
Automated review and build processes reduce complexity and improve the speed and efficiency.
DevSecOps adds security integration and considerations into the devlopment and operations teams.
DevOps pipeline involves all of the tools, processes, and automations required to build, test, and publish software.
A good DevOps pipeline is: repeatable, continuous, always on.
DevOps pipeline stages: Plan, Code, Build, Test, Release, Deploy, Operate, Monitor.
